meanings.definition: In a way that relates to the study of diseases.
meanings.sent1: The doctor pathologically analyzed the patient's symptoms.
meanings.sent2: She pathologically studied the virus under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The researcher pathologically examined the bacteria, looking for clues.
meanings.sent4: Her interest in pathology was so deep that she pathologically dissected every case.
meanings.sent5: The scientist pathologically investigated the cause of the outbreak, leaving no stone unturned.

meanings.definition: In a way that is extreme or excessive.
meanings.sent1: He pathologically obsessed over every detail of the project.
meanings.sent2: The athlete trained pathologically to improve his performance.
meanings.sent3: She pathologically organized her closet, color-coding everything.
meanings.sent4: The student pathologically checked and rechecked his answers before submitting the test.
meanings.sent5: The chef pathologically added more and more spices to the dish, creating a unique flavor.
